name: df-cnp
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5
body: |- wceq(ccnp, cmpo(s0, s1, ctop, ctop, cmpt(s2, cuni(cv(s0)), crab(s3, co(cuni(cv(s1)), cmap, cuni(cv(s0))), wral(s4, cv(s1), wi(wcel(cfv(cv(s3), cv(s2)), cv(s4)), wrex(s5, cv(s0), wa(wcel(cv(s2), cv(s5)), wss(cima(cv(s3), cv(s5)), cv(s4))))))))))
comment: Define a function on two topologies whose value is the set of continuous mappings at a specified point in the first topology. Based on Theorem 7.2(g) of [Munkres] p. 107. (Contributed by NM, 17-Oct-2006.)
